etymologies: mid 17th century: from late Latin precatorius, from precat- ‘prayed’, from the verb precari

definitions: relating to or expressing a wish or request.
shortDefinitions: relating to or expressing wish or request

definitions: (in a will) expressing a wish or intention of the testator

examples.text: a trust can be left in precatory words

shortDefinitions: (in will) expressing wish or request of testator but not necessarily binding
